title: Equivalent resistance - R1 R2 R2 and R3

content.question: The figure shows a portion of a circuit comprised of four resistors. As indicated, two resistors have the same resistance <math alttext="R sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and two have resistances of <math alttext="R sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="R sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>. What is the equivalent resistance of the set of resistors in the figure?

choices.label: <math alttext="R sub 1, end sub, plus the fraction R sub 2 over 2, end fraction, plus R sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="R sub 1, end sub, plus 2 R sub 2, end sub, plus R sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="2 R sub 2, end sub, plus the fraction with numerator R sub 1, end sub, times R sub 3, and denominator R sub 1, end sub, plus R sub 3, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator R sub 1, end sub, times R sub 2, end sub, times R sub 3, and denominator R sub 1, end sub, times R sub 2, end sub, plus R sub 2, end sub, times R sub 3, end sub, plus 2 R sub 1, end sub, times R sub 3, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="R sub 1, end sub, plus the fraction R sub 2 over 2, end fraction, plus R sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
